session.description: The participants of the first session in “Data + International Aid” were Mark Brough, consultant of UNDP Bangladesh, as moderator; and the speakers Yohanna Loucheur, Senior Policy Analyst at Global Affairs, Government of Canada; and Andrea Vaughn, Aid Transparency Analyst for the United States Agency for International Development (USAID).

tweets.content: @jonesiom: @stevieflow @siemvaessen @isiAfrica recharged by #IODC16, #iati coded USD 10 million @StatesofJersey aid flow between flights

@ekoner: More on these data standards: Aid @IATI_aid & grants or philanthropy @360Giving who are working with @opencontracting #IODC16 #joinedupdatahttps://twitter.com/herahussain/status/784350848486936576 …
@herahussain: IATI and 360 giving are good examples of aid and transparency. #IODC16
@opendatacon: We are talking about everything that open data can do for international aid in Room F #IODC16pic.twitter.com/vqgZONT3PN
@BibhusanBista: @YohannaLoucheur sharing important work on integrating aid data with (#IATI data) with budget data from national governments #IODC16pic.twitter.com/jXUF0VXFt2

conference_notes:
• You have to make sure that your colleagues understand the value of IATI, the value of the data; they have to know of the opportunities of the data.
  • We have to focus on making this useful for ourselves. If we think it is useful we will see a lot of improvements.
  • A lot of our colleagues do not have data expertise and we do not have the tools so we need to create them.
  • This work will be spread in all the administration.
  • We are waiting for use cases to come from the private sector, NGOs or CSOs.
  • The methodology to map data from every country into IATI specification is done. Now that the infrastructure is in place we do hope people start using it to the local budget classification and so they can build its own app.
  • There must be more understanding about use cases but also about how relating data is being published.
  • With good use cases it is much easier to explain anything.
name: Data + International Aid I
